title: Great People
pros:
Friendly coworkers
laid back but professional
cons: I don't have anything but positive things to say.

title: Investment Analyst
pros: Good team. Hard to move up in Chicago office.
cons: Need to relocate to other regions to move up in company

title: Don't work here
pros: The work life balance is good here for most departments. Once you get over the hump of the learning curve, leaving at 5pm will be standard. Summer hours are fun, vacation days are reasonable, and holiday time is average. FR has two company parties and people definitely take advantage of those and they are usually pretty fun. Location of the office is conducive for people commuting from the suburbs.
cons: The cons definitely outweigh the pros. The company as a whole is resistant to change and is very much set in their ways. They always ask for new ideas and suggestions, but always shoot them down because “that’s not how we have always done it”. Inefficiencies are abundant as are redundancies. The procedures set in place are ancient and very paper/manual heavy. They need to move forward from the 80s into the 2000’s. There is not a single female in upper management and the company is a pure boys club. Woman need not apply because their skills will not be acknowledged, and even if they are, woman will never get invited to the boys golf outings and cigar room chats and career progression will be zero. Sexist comments are heard in conversation frequently. Basically you need to be a bro to move up in this company. Additionally, upper level positions are held by people who have been with the firm 15+ years and as such, there is zero movement for anyone above a senior/manager position. I’ve seen entire departments (below manager level) turn over completely in less than a year and a half. The lack of movement in upper positions, has led the firm to be very stagnant and to have a culture that is accepting the status quo. Outside of the box thinkers and people who aspire to do more should refrain from applying. Morale is low in the office as a whole, and I think management is totally unaware of this. The office itself is very drab. During their downsizing, FR leased their nice floors and kept the ugly one for themselves. Views are good, but the office looks like it’s from the 80s.

title: Some wonderful people to work with.
pros: My co-workers are great, we have a lot of fun while getting the work done. We are willing to help each other when needed. The company values are good.
cons: The work/life balance is difficult to maintain, the company is not very flexible for ones personal/family time. The time-off policies are strict and they do not offer flex-time, which would be a boon if they did.

title: Good people, entrepreneurial environment, very uncertain future.
pros: There honestly aren't many right now. They are on very shaky financial ground and need to monetize a significant amount of assets to meet $125MM debt maturity in July 2009 and in a very sketchy sales market.
cons: Ability to cover operating costs is very dependent on capital markets which are currently very unfavorable.

title: too much politics and trust issues
pros: Good platform, and some very loyal, hard working employees. Depending on your region, some great upper management.
cons: Lack autonomy in regions, upper management is paranoid, unrealistic expectations if your boss doesn't like you, otherwise, you don't have to do much if they're not threatened and you suck up, unrealistic expectations in both disposition and acquisition. Lost a lot of talent over the last 10 years.

title: It was poorly run when times were good... now a sinking ship.
pros: It was a great place to work in the boom, as the talent was great.... no one is left
cons: Senior level management lacked innovation, and the way of doing things was ancient.

title: Lack of diversity, no room for advancement and very poor upper management
pros: There are really no pros to working for this company
cons: Salaries are not competitive, benefits are mediocre, upper management talks a good game, but does not follow through and there is absolutely no diversity and management likes it that way

title: Quality company with great benefits.
pros: I’ve genuinely enjoyed my time at FR. They have gone out of their way to accommodate my requests and have been very responsive to my needs. Get your work done and they will take care of you!
cons: No advice at this time.

title: Could have been a great place to work, but it was hit hard by the economy, don't think it's coming back
pros: was a young culture, benefits were good when times were good
cons: layoffs were a constant fear workload increased without pay increase or even title promotions

title: Overall great place to work
pros: Great people, good pay and benefits, great location
cons: Little growth opportunities and work gets a little repetitive. Not a lot of movement within the company.

title: ok place to work
pros: overall everynoe was nice, work was sometimes interesting-was able to learn new things

title: Keep looking
pros: Good benefits and some nice people to work with.

title: Always something new

title: Do your research
pros: Good people to work with. Ok work life balance.

title: Not a place to work if you want to promote
pros: The company offers a descent benefit package and 401(k), although they don't match. They have good office locations thoughout the USA.
cons: A lot of people work really hard and don't ever get recognized for the work they do. Management- middle management- takes credit for work done by others to get money/incentives.

title: Hitting Bottom, But Don't Expect Bounce
pros: Lean company after 5 rounds of cuts
cons: No growth in foreseeable future. Likely candidate to be bought for assets alone.
